name: OKR Ontology (Objectives & Key Results)
description: Comprehensive ontology for the Objectives and Key Results (OKR) framework enabling AI-driven goal management, alignment tracking, and performance optimisation. Part of the VE-Series lineage chain: VSOM → OKR → VP → PMF.
author: PF-Core VE Module

metadata.purpose: Define canonical OKR entities for goal-setting, alignment cascading, and progress tracking across organisational levels
metadata.scope: Enterprise OKR programs from company-level through team and individual objectives

hasDefinedTerm.name: Objective
hasDefinedTerm.description: A qualitative, inspirational, time-bound goal that defines what an organisation, team, or individual wants to achieve. Objectives cascade from company to team to individual levels.

objectiveName.description: Clear, concise name of the objective

objectiveDescription.description: Detailed description of purpose and context

owner.description: Person or team responsible for the objective

progressPercentage.description: Weighted average progress from key results (0-100%)

strategicAlignment.description: How this objective aligns with organisational strategy

instances.description: Top-level strategic objective set by leadership
Department-level objective aligned to company goals
Team-level objective supporting department goals
Individual contributor objective supporting team goals

hasDefinedTerm.name: KeyResult
hasDefinedTerm.description: A quantitative, measurable outcome that indicates progress toward achieving an objective. Each objective should have 2-5 key results with weighted contributions.

keyResultId.description: Unique identifier for the key result

keyResultName.description: Clear, measurable statement of the key result

keyResultDescription.description: Detailed description of what the key result measures and why

unit.description: Unit of measurement (points, percentage, dollars, count)

weight.description: Weight of this KR in objective calculation

progressPercentage.description: Progress based on current vs target

instances.description: Key result targeting an increase in a measurable metric
Key result targeting a decrease in a measurable metric
Key result targeting achievement of a specific milestone
Key result with yes/no completion criteria

hasDefinedTerm.name: Initiative
hasDefinedTerm.description: A specific project, programme, or action taken to achieve a key result. Initiatives are the executable work items that drive measurable progress on key results.

estimatedImpact.description: Estimated impact on the key result value

actualImpact.description: Actual measured impact on the key result

instances.description: A time-bounded project driving key result progress
An ongoing programme contributing to key result achievement
A hypothesis-driven experiment to test impact on key results

hasDefinedTerm.name: CheckIn
hasDefinedTerm.description: A periodic update recording progress, confidence, blockers, and commentary on an objective or key result. Check-ins drive the cadence of OKR reviews.

instances.description: Weekly progress check-in for active OKR cycles
Monthly review check-in with deeper analysis
End-of-cycle scoring and retrospective check-in

hasDefinedTerm.name: TimePeriod
hasDefinedTerm.description: A defined time period bounding an OKR cycle, typically quarterly or annually. Time periods structure the cadence of objective setting, tracking, and review.

instances.description: Annual OKR cycle covering the full fiscal year
Quarterly OKR cycle, the most common cadence
Monthly OKR cycle for fast-moving teams
Custom time period for special initiatives

hasDefinedTerm.name: ObjectiveType
hasDefinedTerm.description: Classification of objective types by organisational scope, from company-level strategic objectives through department, team, and individual contributor objectives.

instances.description: Company-level strategic objective
Department-level objective
Team-level objective
Individual contributor objective
Cross-functional initiative objective

hasDefinedTerm.name: ObjectiveStatus
hasDefinedTerm.description: Lifecycle status values tracking the progression of objectives from draft through active execution to completion or cancellation.

isTerminal.description: Whether this is a terminal state

instances.description: Objective is being formulated
Objective is active and being tracked
Objective progress is on track (≥70% confidence)
Objective is at risk (40-69% confidence)
Objective is off track (<40% confidence)
Objective has been completed and scored
Objective was cancelled before completion

hasDefinedTerm.name: KeyResultType
hasDefinedTerm.description: Types of key result measurement approaches defining how progress is calculated from start value toward target value across different metric patterns.

instances.description: Increase a metric from baseline to target
Decrease a metric from baseline to target
Maintain a metric within acceptable bounds
Achieve a defined milestone with steps
Yes/No binary completion

hasDefinedTerm.name: KeyResultStatus
hasDefinedTerm.description: Status values tracking the progression of key results from not started through active measurement to final achievement scoring.

isTerminal.description: Whether this is a terminal state

instances.description: Key result measurement has not begun
Key result is being actively tracked
Key result is on track to be achieved
Key result achievement is at risk
Key result is off track
Key result target has been achieved
Key result was partially achieved
Key result was not achieved

hasDefinedTerm.name: PriorityLevel
hasDefinedTerm.description: Priority levels for ranking objectives by importance and urgency, used to allocate focus and resources when multiple objectives compete.

instances.description: Critical priority, must-achieve objective
High priority, strongly expected to achieve
Medium priority, important but flexible
Low priority, aspirational stretch goal

hasDefinedTerm.name: InitiativeStatus
hasDefinedTerm.description: Status values tracking the lifecycle of initiatives from planning through execution to completion, enabling portfolio-level visibility of OKR execution.

isTerminal.description: Whether this is a terminal state

instances.description: Initiative is planned but not started
Initiative is actively being executed
Initiative has been completed
Initiative is paused
Initiative was cancelled

hasDefinedTerm.name: PeriodType
hasDefinedTerm.description: Types of OKR time periods defining the cadence of objective setting and review cycles. Quarterly is the most common cadence for OKR programmes.

periodCode.description: Short code for the period type

instances.description: Annual OKR cycle
Quarterly OKR cycle (recommended default)
Monthly OKR cycle
Custom time period for special initiatives

relationships.name: hasKeyResult
relationships.description: Links an Objective to its measurable Key Results (2-5 per objective)

relationships.name: hasInitiative
relationships.description: Links a Key Result to executable initiatives that drive progress

relationships.name: hasCheckIn
relationships.description: Links an Objective to its periodic progress check-ins

relationships.name: updatesKeyResult
relationships.description: Check-in records progress updates against a specific Key Result

relationships.name: alignsTo
relationships.description: Links an Objective to a higher-level Objective it aligns with in the cascade

relationships.name: dependsOn
relationships.description: Indicates a dependency between Key Results across objectives or teams

relationships.name: scopedByPeriod
relationships.description: Objective is time-bounded by a specific OKR cycle period

relationships.name: hasObjectiveType
relationships.description: Classifies the organisational scope of an Objective

relationships.name: hasObjectiveStatus
relationships.description: Tracks the current lifecycle status of an Objective

relationships.name: hasPriority
relationships.description: Assigns a priority level to an Objective for resource allocation

relationships.name: hasKeyResultType
relationships.description: Classifies how a Key Result measures progress (increase, decrease, milestone, binary)

relationships.name: hasKeyResultStatus
relationships.description: Tracks the current lifecycle status of a Key Result

relationships.name: hasInitiativeStatus
relationships.description: Tracks the current execution status of an Initiative

relationships.name: hasPeriodType
relationships.description: Defines the cadence type of a TimePeriod (annual, quarterly, monthly)

businessRules.name: ObjectiveKeyResultsCount
businessRules.description: Every objective must have between 2 and 5 key results to maintain focus

businessRules.name: KeyResultTargetDiffers
businessRules.description: Key result target value must differ from start value to be measurable

businessRules.name: KeyResultWeightsSum
businessRules.description: All key result weights for an objective should sum to 100
businessRules.condition: IF okr:Objective has multiple KeyResults with weights

businessRules.name: ObjectiveTimePeriodRequired
businessRules.description: Every objective must be scoped to a time period with defined start and end dates
businessRules.action: THEN okr:scopedByPeriod relationship must exist with valid TimePeriod

businessRules.name: ProgressFromKeyResults
businessRules.description: Objective progress percentage is the weighted average of its key results

businessRules.name: AlignmentCascadeRequired
businessRules.description: Non-company objectives must align to at least one higher-level objective
businessRules.action: THEN okr:alignsTo relationship must exist to a higher-level Objective

businessRules.name: CheckInCadenceRequired
businessRules.description: Active objectives should have at least one check-in per month
businessRules.condition: IF okr:ObjectiveStatus = ACTIVE or ON_TRACK or AT_RISK or OFF_TRACK
businessRules.action: THEN okr:hasCheckIn should have entries within last 30 days

businessRules.name: InitiativeLinksKeyResult
businessRules.description: Every initiative must be linked to at least one key result it supports
businessRules.action: THEN okr:hasInitiative relationship must connect to at least one KeyResult

crossOntologyReferences.description: OKR sits in the VE lineage chain between VSOM (strategic objectives) and VP (value propositions). Key results connect to KPI for measurement.

lineageAlignment.vsom:ObjectivesComponent: Drives okr:Objective creation from strategic framework
lineageAlignment.vp:ValueProposition: Key results inform value proposition evidence
lineageAlignment.kpi:KPI: Key results measured by KPI definitions
